segments.text: I notice the calmness of the garden visible through the window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It feels like a stark contrast to the commotion happening inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so absorbed in her task, she’s missing all the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe that water is just spilling everywhere!
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What if something breaks? The thought frustrates me to no end.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching for cookies, completely oblivious to the danger he’s in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder who taught him that it was okay to climb on that stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl next to him looks so eager, but I can't help but feel a bit disgusted by this sneaky behavior.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This moment feels so innocent yet so reckless.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a mix of amusement and concern watching them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will they get caught? Will the woman ever notice what’s going on?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I just want to call out, but I know I shouldn’t interfere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything about this feels like a tightly coiled spring, ready to snap.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The tension is palpable, and I can’t shake the feeling that something is about to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR
